reviews.review_msg: Sarah really cares about the success of her students, she never hesitated to clarify any lecture material or expectations with me in her office hours. Her expectations are impressively clear, and participation matters (you can still get a good participation grade even without talking in lectures). Can be a hard marker, but nothing unfair.

Sarah always tries to elaborate on material as much as she can, and frequently asks if we need clarification. Attendance matters because of quizzes and participation marks, but lectures are insightful and fun. She tried so hard to facilitate classes moving online so last minute and she made herself very accessible to the class if we had any concern

Honestly the classwork was pretty easy. There's frequent quizzes but they're really short and you can ace them easily if you at least half listen during lecture. Sarah's very kind, obviously cares very much for her students. She encourages people to speak up during lecture but never calls on anyone who doesn't wanna talk so introverts you're safe
Sarah truly cares about her students. Grading is really fair. would definitely take another class with her.

Hilarious,  approachable, and marks easy. Calls out the class if readings weren't done but makes readings very approachable. A little dry in lectures and sometimes marked unclearly. This was my first philosophy class and was such a positive experience! Hand in the small assignments on time and use her lectures as inspiration for essay topics
He cancelled so many classes. His lectures are heavy and you need to make notes of everything.
He is an okay prof at best. He can be a bit of a tough grader because he searches for very specific details. If you don't know much about philosophy, you may struggle!

Simon is one rad dude. His lectures are great, sometimes off topic but he always brings it back in a relevant way. His lectures really help to clarify the readings, and he's super approachable. He's also incredibly fair in his testing! If he hasn't covered smth in lecture he wont test you on it. Overall a great prof, I really recommend him
Very engaging courses, would take again. Each class was looked forward to, and enjoyed all the debates that ensued.

Philosophy is hard to read. Ancient Philosophy is even harder to read. His lectures make up for it. He explains things clearly and goes off on interesting tangents. He teaches in a style similar to ancient philosophers. However this means you need to go to lecture, as he makes no slides. Go to class, maybe make notes in class, and you'll be fine.
Cool introduction to philosophy, covers a lot of ground. If you go to lecture and do the readings/take notes you should do well.

You can tell she really cares about her students and about philosophy. This was a lecture style course, so lectures are expected, but she does answer student questions. If you do the readings and pay attention the evaluations are easy.

Bill is a great professor.  He has a very casual teaching style which encourages non-phil majors to participate in class, which is refreshing.  Although he speaks casually with the class, he is great at delivering the material and providing a thorough explanation.  Highest attendance rate compared to all my other classes.

This was definitely a hard class. If you've never taken a philosophy course before, like me, you will find the material quite challenging. But Barthelemy does a wonderful job explaining things. He tells very funny jokes at times and makes phil much more interesting. Exams were brutal, the final consisted of 6 essays! Work hard and you'll do fine.
Do yourself a favor and take a class with Bill.  Some of the most interesting lectures I've ever heard.  Tough class, hard marker.  But totally worth it.

Smart guy.  Interesting lectures.  Tells funny jokes sometimes. Exams are okay. Lots of materials to know.  Some of the stuff are just too difficult to comprehend. Overall, an interesting course, and this is perhaps one of the easier philosophy courses to take.

This man has more passion for philosophy than I have ever seen in another human being. He really connects with his students and tries to make ancient philosophy--something rather obscure, interesting and relates it to our modern world. He has a broad spectrum of knowledge, not just philosophy. My favourite professor so far. Take this class.

Great guy, funny, and intelligent. Willing to answer lots of questions, and therefore goes off on a tangent sometimes. Midterm and final weren't really hard. Questions were predictable, like he says, and as long as you've attended lecture and somewhat read the book, you'll do fine. Very rarely gives A+'s though, so don't aim that high.

A great professor and philosopher. He has a clear interest in the course material and makes the class fun and interesting. Made some of the more abstract concepts crystal clear. Very funny, and is very open to class discussion. Bill is always happy to talk to students and discuss philosophy with them. Fair tests and a fairly easy marker.
Great Prof. - I take any classes he is teaching even though they are outside my major

This was a great class. He was very knowledgeable and helpful and I found it incredibly interesting. It was a relatively difficult class, but it is Philosophy so I expected that. I would definitley recommend this prof to anyone. He will make you think, and express his own views without pushing them on anyone else.

This guy knows something about everything and he will never make your questions or comments seem dumb.  Take some time to talk to him, he's super interesting.  His classes are super fun, especially if you start getting involved.  I never skipped.
awesome.  He knows a little bit about everything, so even if you're not a philosophy person, you will have something to contribute because the discusssions go everywhere.
what the hell....
He was a boring teacher. He'd make a great paperweight though.
No Comments
amazing prof, this class became a gpa booster for me and i learned so much about asian philosophy, will definetely take this prof again if i get the chance to!

Course consisted of weekly responses and a final passage analysis assignment. Super chill prof, has a book which is used to as "textbook but is not required. Only problem with the course is the TA who marks difficultly. Otherwise I would recommend taking this course.

FAVOURITE PROF FR, no midterms just weekly assignments and his assignments aren't so hard as long as you put effort into it. Whoever the ta for this semester is i hope ur reading this and hope ur charger always work. You guys are an amazing team. TAKE 150 W THIS PROF YOU WILL LOVE IT

This has been one of the most interesting classes I have taken in a long time. Took it because I had a pretty heavy semester and just wanted something not super insane. Weekly reading assignments and an assignment to come but no exams, which has been nice.

Awesome prof!! His youthful vibe and style of teaching is amazing. Super understanding and the lecture material is very interesting. Submit the weekly assignments, do the readings, and you'll breeze through the class.

Nic's absolutely awesome, the lectures aren't mandatory but super useful. Didn't even need to use the textbook, just show up and listen and the weekly assignments should be a breeze. Not only easy to do well in, but actually interesting and engaging content and delivery. 10/10 would recommend.

Nic's lectures were engaging, informative, and straight to the point, all the while being laidback and humorous too. Genuinely looked forward to his classes every week. You can tell that he's passionate and knowledgeable in the material, which sparked my curiosity on the topics as well.

Professor Bommarito is an absolute gem of a prof. His teaching style is amazing--most of your grade comes from weekly reading responses from the texts covered in lec. Though some of the material can be tricky to grasp, he explains things so clearly with great analogies and examples, also throwing in jokes here and there! Absolutely rec taking him!

Super chill, funny, down to earth prof. Gives banger lectures and workload is relatively light: weekly responses to questions based off excerpts + a final project. No exams. Recommend to anyone who wants a strong intro to asian philosophy. *Note that the grade cutoffs are brutal e.g., got an A- with 95.7%. Avg will be high due to the class nature.

Great teacher! Very approachable, knowledgeable and inspiring. His classes are very helpful, fun and he is also a fair marker. His goal is to make students to understand ancient Greek philosophy and why western civilization is how it is today. He is trying to teach students how to read philosophy, think rational and stand on their own feet.
I'm taking his class phil-150 now, his class is awesome! He's the best teacher i've ever met at SFU!
